intro: Oxytropis saposhnikovii, commonly known as Siberian locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Russia, Kazakhstan, and Mongolia. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow to orange flowers in spikes, which bloom in late summer. Oxytropis saposhnikovii is adapted to harsh, arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
